issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:

comments.body:
I think this failure is related to this checkin for DERBY-3431
http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=rev&revision=658181
	

DERBY-3431: DatabaseMetaData.getConnection returns the wrong connection when using connection pooling.
Added another tests for this issue in DatabaseMetaDataTest.
Only the test for embedded is enabled, as the client driver has a bug.
Also note that the embedded driver has a related bug, but it is not exposed by this test (see J2EEDataSourceTest.testConnectionLeakInDatabaseMetaData instead).

Ah, sorry about that failure.

Would returning an empty suite in DatabaseMetaDataTest.connectionPoolingSuite when running with J2ME fix the problem?
I can have a look at that tomorrow unless someone else beats me to it, but then I have to setup an environment for running with J2ME to verify the fix.

'derby-3685-1a-disable_test_javame.diff' disabled the connection pooling tests if we are running in a JavaME environment.

An alternative fix would be to move the if clause to the suite method, and simply not add any empty suites.
Patch ready for review.

Tested with PhoneME Advanced. Testing on other ME platforms appreciated.
I tried DatabaseMetaDataTest with the patch  on  weme 6.1 and it passes.  I think your change looks fine.  +1 to commit.

Committed 'derby-3685-1a-disable_test_javame.diff' to trunk with revision 659166.

Thanks to Kathey for reviewing the patch and testing it in a JavaME environment.
